definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: You got a celebrity world, big figures on TV. But it is false.
sentences.chinese: 一个就是名人的世界，电视上的大腕，但那都是假的。

sentences.english: David Beckham is a big-timer in the football world.
sentences.chinese: 贝克汉姆是足球界的大腕。

sentences.english: Body Works is located in Sanlitun near the residence of the international players.
sentences.chinese: 位于工体三里屯附近，国际大腕府邸。

sentences.english: The director decided not to cast his new film with big-name actors.
sentences.chinese: 导演决定，新的影片将不再使用大腕演员。

sentences.english: Media guru Yang Lan raises money for Specia.
sentences.chinese: 传媒大腕杨澜为特奥会筹资。

sentences.english: But only the romantic comedy "Larry Crowne" stars two of Hollywood's biggest names.
sentences.chinese: 但只有浪漫喜剧“拉里皇冠”明星好莱坞大腕两个。

sentences.english: To make exclusive interviews with those big shots is difficult nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 现如今对那些大腕做专访是很难的事情。

sentences.english: Her job allows her to meet all sorts of movers and shakers from the entertainment industry.
sentences.chinese: 她的工作让她能够接触到娱乐圈里的大腕儿们。

sentences.english: The manufacturer hires a well-known star to plug its products.
sentences.chinese: 厂商聘请一个大腕儿作为其产品代言人。

definition: strong card/honor card (card games)/very popular or successful person/self-important
erhua variant of 名角[ming2 jue2]
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
(neologism c. 2014) celebrity with a huge, devoted fan base/celebrity with a huge following on social media
big shot (leading some field or group)/godfather
lit. big crocodile/fig. major figure/big shot/top boss (esp. criminal)
